intro: Ficus concinna, commonly known as the concinna fig, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are followed by edible figs, which are encased in a greenish-white receptacle. Ficus concinna thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting habit.
